hooks.prompt: If editing automations.yaml, scripts.yaml, scenes.yaml, or other HA config files: After making changes, remind the user they can run /ha-deploy to validate and deploy when ready. Do not auto-deploy.

If the file just written/edited has a .yaml extension AND appears to be a Home Assistant configuration file (contains automation:, script:, scene:, light:, sensor:, or similar HA domains), briefly validate the YAML structure. Check for: 1) Proper indentation (2 spaces), 2) Valid boolean values (true/false not True/False), 3) Valid entity_id format (domain.name). If issues found, warn the user. If the file is not an HA config file, do nothing.
